Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 15

Intermediate

Intermediate Vocabulary - Page 15

Congratulations! You've completed all 180 intermediate vocabulary words. These words will significantly enhance your English communication skills in academic and professional settings.

Navigation

This is the final page (15 of 15). Use the navigation below to review previous pages or return to the vocabulary overview.

Word List

Range

/reɪndʒ/

noun, verb

The area of variation between upper and lower limits; to vary or extend between specified limits.

"The store offers a wide range of products for different budgets."

Synonyms: variety, scope, extent

Category: Variety

Reason

/ˈriːzən/

noun, verb

A cause, explanation, or justification for an action or event.

"The reason for the meeting is to discuss the new project timeline."

Synonyms: cause, explanation, motive

Category: Logic

Receive

/rɪˈsiːv/

verb

To be given, presented with, or paid something.

"Students will receive their certificates at the graduation ceremony."

Synonyms: get, obtain, acquire

Category: Getting

Relationship

/rɪˈleɪʃənʃɪp/

noun

The way in which two or more concepts, objects, or people are connected.

"Building strong relationships with colleagues is important for career success."

Synonyms: connection, association, bond

Category: Connection

Research

/rɪˈsɜːrtʃ/

noun, verb

The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources.

"The professor is conducting research on renewable energy sources."

Synonyms: investigation, study, inquiry

Category: Investigation

Resource

/ˈriːsɔːrs/

noun

A stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets.

"The library has many online resources for students to use."

Synonyms: asset, material, supply

Category: Supply

Respond

/rɪˈspɑːnd/

verb

To say something in reply; to react quickly and positively.

"Please respond to the email within 24 hours."

Synonyms: reply, answer, react

Category: Communication

Responsibility

/rɪˌspɑːnsəˈbɪləti/

noun

The state or fact of having a duty to deal with something.

"It's everyone's responsibility to protect the environment."

Synonyms: duty, obligation, accountability

Category: Duty

Result

/rɪˈzʌlt/

noun, verb

A consequence, effect, or outcome of something.

"The result of the experiment confirmed our hypothesis."

Synonyms: outcome, consequence, effect

Category: Outcome

Society

/səˈsaɪəti/

noun

The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.

"Technology has had a profound impact on modern society."

Synonyms: community, civilization, culture

Category: Community

Structure

/ˈstrʌktʃər/

noun, verb

The arrangement of and relations between the parts of something complex.

"The building has a strong steel structure that can withstand earthquakes."

Synonyms: framework, organization, arrangement

Category: Organization

System

/ˈsɪstəm/

noun

A set of connected parts forming a complex whole.

"The school has implemented a new computer system for student records."

Synonyms: method, process, organization

Category: Organization
